Extract relevant Baywatchers data from ginormous Excel file

Source: R/extract_baywatchers.R
extract_baywatchers.Rd

Pulls the relevant site, date, and DO values from the Baywatchers source file for a given year. Rows with DO_QC = 9 will be dropped. Rows with missing times (column TIME) will also be dropped. The results will be written to <year>/baywatchers.csv, along with a hash file, bay_hash.txt.

Usage

extract_baywatchers(
  base_dir,
  year,
  file = "bbcdataCURRENT.xlsx",
  header_line = 3
)

Arguments

base_dir

Path to BB_Data base directory

year

Year to extract data for

file

File name of Baywatchers Excel file. This file must be in the base directory.

header_line

Line in the Excel with headers

Details

Run this before report_site if you want to include the two Baywatchers plots (run with baywatchers = TRUE). It only needs to be run once for each year (or if the Baywatchers data are updated). check_site will check to make sure baywatchers.csv is up to date with respect to the source Excel file.

On this page
